places.name: Cape Coast Castle
places.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this historic castle played a significant role in the transatlantic slave trade and offers a deep, sobering look into Ghana’s past.

places.name: Kakum National Park
places.description: Famous for its canopy walkway suspended high above the rainforest, this park is home to diverse wildlife and breathtaking scenery.

places.name: Mole National Park
places.description: Ghana’s largest wildlife park, where visitors can see elephants, antelopes, and leopards in their natural habitat.

places.name: Independence Arch
places.description: A symbol of Ghana’s freedom from colonial rule, this iconic monument is a must-visit landmark in the capital city.

places.name: Lake Bosomtwe
places.description: Ghana’s only natural lake, formed by a meteor impact, is a peaceful retreat surrounded by lush hills and traditional fishing villages.

places.name: Wli Waterfalls
places.description: The tallest waterfall in West Africa, offering a stunning natural spectacle surrounded by lush greenery.

places.name: Nzulezu Stilt Village
places.description: A picturesque village built entirely on stilts over Lake Tadane, showcasing the ingenuity of local communities.

places.name: Boti Falls
places.description: A twin waterfall with cultural significance, believed to symbolize male and female energies, offering a breathtaking natural experience.
